intro: Mesembryanthemum aggregatum, commonly known as the clustered iceplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in the spring. Its fleshy, water-storing leaves help it survive in arid environments. Mesembryanthemum aggregatum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
